biography.summary: Tammy Baldwin is an American lawyer and politician who has served as the United States Senator from Wisconsin since 2013. She is the first openly gay person elected to the U.S. Senate and previously served in the U.S. House of Representatives from Wisconsin’s 2nd district (1999-2013).
biography.early_life: Tammy Baldwin was born on February 11, 1962, in Madison, Wisconsin.
biography.education: University of Wisconsin–Madison (BA); University of Wisconsin Law School (JD).
biography.career: Prior to the Senate, Baldwin represented Wisconsin's 2nd congressional district in the U.S. House of Representatives (1999–2013); she was sworn in as U.S. Senator in 2013.

contact.office_address: 141 Hart Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510

timeline.event: Elected to the U.S. House of Representatives from Wisconsin's 2nd district.
Sworn in as United States Senator from Wisconsin.

videos.title: Tammy Baldwin remarks on the Senate floor
